content.question: An “eight-ball pool” video game is being designed with a rectangular region (known as a pool table) of width <math alttext="1000"><mn>1000</mn></math> pixels and height <math alttext="800"><mn>800</mn></math> pixels. The designer wants to create a linear path for a ball with an initial position of <math alttext="open parentheses 250 comma 400 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>250</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>400</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and a straight path that ends in the upper right corner of the region at <math alttext="open parentheses 1000 comma 800 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>800</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>. Which of the following parametric functions models the ball traveling along this line segment over a <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>-second interval of time?

choices.label: <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses 250 plus 200 t comma 400 plus 375 t close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>250</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>200</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>400</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>375</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 2"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="g open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses 250 plus 375 t comma 400 plus 200 t close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>250</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>375</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>400</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>200</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 2"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses 250 plus 750 t comma 400 plus 400 t close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>250</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>750</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>400</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>400</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 1"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

<math alttext="k open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses 250 plus 750 t comma 400 plus 400 t close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>250</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>750</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>400</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>400</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 2"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="g open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses 250 plus 375 t comma 400 plus 200 t close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>250</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>375</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>400</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>200</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 2"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
